subject: Systems: Add PowerMode support
commitMessage:
Systems: Add PowerMode support

The computer system power mode defines the behavior of a system
based on the performance and power saving requirements.
For example, a system could be set to MaximumPerformance to
run as fast as possible without regard to power consumption.
A system could also be configured to run in PowerSaving mode
which would be running at slower speeds to try to save power.
More information can be found at https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/docs/+/38786

This commit will allow GET / PATCH operations to the PowerMode property

PowerMode was added in Redfish Release 2021.1:
https://www.dmtf.org/content/redfish-release-20211-now-available

Tested: I manually tested retrieving and setting the PowerMode property
on a Rainier system (with good and bad values):
  # curl -k https://$bmc/redfish/v1/Systems/system
  {
    "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/Systems/system",
    "@odata.type": "#ComputerSystem.v1_15_0.ComputerSystem
  ...
    "PartNumber": "",
    "PowerMode": "MaximumPerformance",
    "PowerMode@Redfish.AllowableValues": [
      "Static",
      "MaximumPerformance",
      "PowerSaving"
    ],
    "PowerRestorePolicy": "AlwaysOff",
  ...
  # curl -k https://$bmc/xyz/openbmc_project/control/host0/power_mode
  {
    "data": {
      "PowerMode": "xyz.openbmc_project.Control.Power.Mode.PowerMode.MaximumPerformance"
    },
    "message": "200 OK",
    "status": "ok"
  }
  # curl -k -X PATCH -d '{ "PowerMode":"Static"}' https://$bmc/redfish/v1/Systems/system
  curl -k https://$bmc/xyz/openbmc_project/control/host0/power_mode
  {
    "data": {
      "PowerMode": "xyz.openbmc_project.Control.Power.Mode.PowerMode.Static"
    },
    "message": "200 OK",
    "status": "ok"
  }
Ran Validator on hardware and all tests passed:
Elapsed time: 0:05:07
Counter({'skipOptional': 7128, 'pass': 6020, 'metadataNamespaces': 2217, 'passGet': 315, 'warnDeprecated': 212, 'serviceNamespaces': 79, 'warningPresent': 47, 'warnTrailingSlashLink': 24, 'invalidPropertyValue': 18, 'passAction': 14, 'optionalAction': 11, 'repeat': 3, 'unverifiedComplexAdditional': 1})
Validation has succeeded.

Signed-off-by: Chris Cain <cjcain@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I5523a0ebe4a2a77ea4709a14863bff7b55f0303d

This isn't going to work. This will return right away.
But you found it in mapper. I think messages::internalError(aResp->res); here.
This will be a validator error. There is no UNKNOWN enum

But the client tried to set this.. 
messages::internalError(aResp->res); ?

I agree on the GET this makes sense but the user PATCHed this.
GetSubTree below so you don't hardcode this?
GetSubTree so you can get the service too?

nitpick: "Tested:" field. 
From https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/92696982a22d8952b16c399f88898623d9e8b8ab/DEVELOPING.md
Your change should not introduce any new validator errors. Please include the Redfish Service Validator results as part of the commit message "Tested" field.
Any other mode should be an internal error, considering that those modes are the only ones supported by the interface.

Agreed.  There is a case where a system can be configured to a non-standard power mode that is not settable by a customer.  In that case we want to return OEM on the GET.  I updated the code to allow OEM to be returned on the GET and return internal error for any other value.  (OEM will still be rejected by the PATCH)
Please put this in its own method.
This is a very inefficient way to do a lookup, and is generally a banned anti-pattern in bmcweb.  Please do what you did on line 1743, and put it in its own method
Please remove from this list.  Unless the OEM policy is followed, this redfish interface will not accept OEM APIs, and if it does, that is a discussion for another commit.
This check should be done before calling getSubTree.

Should this also contain "OEM"?
I am not sure that should or should not.
No, I don't think it makes sense to allow it be set to OEM
No.  Customer can not set it to OEM mode.
Again to have "OEM" or to not have "OEM" that is my question.

No Oem for the PATCH.
 
I like how Chris has it. 

Set the Redfish property to Oem if the D-Bus interface is set to the value Oem (it shouldn't be normally) so Oem support on GetPowerMode but don't allow Oem to be set in the PATCH.
No here also, since customer can not set it to OEM.
